detail.content: Three Sisters: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Three Sisters   Event Date and Time: March 26, 2015 – March 31, 2015 Showtimes are nightly at 8pm and 2pm on Saturday and Sunday Location: Atlas Theatre 111 Second Avenue, 3rd Floor By Anton Chekhov   A new version by Tracy Letts,   Directed by Mark Wing-Davey.      Chekhov's immortal romance of longing and belonging gets refracted through the lens of two versions of the play in repertory: one that embodies the classical context of the early 20th Century and another that brings forth the dysfunctional optimism of glasnost int he 1980s.      This production is actually two different versions of the same play. The ANTON Company is set in 1988, the CHEKHOV company is set in 1901.      Thursday, March 26 8pm — CHEKHOV Company   Friday, March 27 8pm — ANTON Company   Saturday. March 28 2pm — CHEKHOV Company   Saturday, March 28 8pm — CHEKHOV Company   Sunday, March 29 2pm — ANTON Company   Sunday, March 29 8pm — ANTON Company   Monday, March 30 8pm — CHEKHOV Company   Tuesday, March 31 8pm — ANTON Company      General Admission: $15   Students/Seniors: $10   Tickets can be purchased through www.BrownPaperTickets.com or by calling 800-838-3006  Graduate Acting Web Site  Theatrical Production Box Office               Phone:       212 998 1921           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Master Classes in the Michael Chekhov Technique: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content          < back        Michael Chekhov DVD Set with intro by Zelda Fichandler      "These DVDs, with their talented teachers and responsive, inquisitive students are an immeasurably creative tool for teaching and learning, getting closer to the actor's art and serving as a legacy for the seminal work of Michael Chekhov."    - Zelda Fichandler, Chair, Tisch School of the Arts, Graduate Acting Program    Zelda Fichandler has written the introduction to this set of three DVDs which are professionally produced to a high broadcast quality and present an unprecedented level of access to the practice of the Chekhov technique. Tisch Graduate Acting faculty member, Joanna Merlin, produced and is co-artistic director of this six hour collection of filmed workshops by world-renowned Chekhov experts demonstrating his approach to actor-training, including:       exercises in body awareness    'the four brothers' - Ease, Form, Beauty, and sense of the whole    qualities of movement - molding, floating, flying and radiating    psychological gesture    imaginary body and character's center    The DVD brings to life all the essential elements of the Michael Chekhov technique in a way which is clear, engaging, practical and dynamic. It is a unique and essential training tool for all teachers, students, actors and directors and a copy should be in every library in every institution.    Produced by the Michael Chekhov Association, the classes feature many of the world's leading practitioners and teachers of the Michael Chekhov Technique, including teachers Ragnar Freidank, Joanna Merlin, Lenard Petit, Ted Pugh and Fern Sloan and actors Dawn Arnold, Bethany Caputo, Jessica Cerullo, John Capalbo, Anne Gottleib, Hugh O'Gorman and Mel Shrawder. The classes are followed by a panel discussion with former students of Michael Chekhov, Jack Colvin, Joanna Merlin and Mala Powers.    Produced by the Michael Chekhov Association, DVD series is distributed by Routledge. Visit the Michael Chekhov Association web site for more information or visit Routledge to order the DVD set. The Seagull: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content          < back        The Seagull   Event Date and Time: April 10, 2014 – April 15, 2014 Thursday, April 10 8pm - ANTON Company Friday, April 11 8pm- CHEKHOV Company Saturday. April 12 2pm - CHEKHOV Company Saturday, April 12 8pm - ANTON Company Sunday, April 13 2pm - ANTON Company Sunday, April 13 8pm - CHEKHOV Company Monday, April 14 8pm - ANTON Company Tuesday, April 15 8pm - CHEKHOV Company Location: Atlas Theatre 111 2nd Ave, 3rd floor New York, NY 10003 Chekhov's first play is perhaps his most moving and most theatrical; two generations of artists stand apart from each other--separated by ambition and talent, but bound together by maddening and inescapable ties of affection and desire. This version will be presented in two different productions, featuring the same cast, in repertory with itself.      $15 general admission, $10 students/seniors   Tickets available through www.smarttix.com        Graduate Acting Web Site           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
